parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. While the post doesn't explicitly name a candidate, it clearly refers to the author, Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, who is identified as a future MP candidate.  This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a" as it directly refers to a person running for a public office.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The language used ("Dragi prieteni," "noi toți," etc.) further reinforces this intention. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The post proposes a legislative initiative aimed at improving the quality of public leadership. While presented as a policy proposal, the underlying objective is to enhance the author's image as a responsible and competent candidate, indirectly influencing voters' perception and potentially their choice. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents a policy proposal, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content.  The language used is persuasive and promotional, aiming to garner support for the author's candidacy rather than providing impartial information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post is not a simple expression of personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to promote the candidate and his policy proposal, with the clear intention of influencing voters.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1289211355428130</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while seemingly presenting a policy proposal, functions as electoral propaganda. It directly refers to the author, Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, a candidate for a public office, and aims to influence voters' perception of his competence and responsibility. The paid nature of the post, its broad reach, and persuasive language all point towards an intention to sway public opinion in favor of the candidate.  The post's timing, after the official campaign period, is also a crucial factor.  While the post doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for him, the implicit message is clear: supporting this policy proposal is tantamount to supporting the candidate himself.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Sebastian Tiberiu Pop</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Responsabilul Sebastian Tiberiu Pop], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1289211355428130) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care, deși prezentată ca o propunere legislativă, constituie propagandă electorală. Postarea face referire directă la candidatul Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, prezentându-l ca viitor deputat și promovându-i imaginea ca un candidat responsabil și competent, cu scopul clar de a influența votul alegătorilor.  Utilizarea unui limbaj persuasiv și a unei platforme cu o rază largă de acoperire, precum Facebook, întărește intenția de a influența opinia publică în favoarea candidatului.  Chiar dacă nu solicită explicit votul, mesajul implicit este clar: susținerea propunerii legislative echivalează cu susținerea candidatului.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
